body.name: So I'm a Spider, So What?, Vol. 9 (light novel) (So I'm a Spider, So What? (light novel))
body.description: Let's go pay God a visit...So I can make thread again. That's...something, I guess. Don't get me wrong-I could be doing a whole lot worse than pumping out thread all day while cooped up in some demon's mansion. I just wish my other powers would come back alrea-Oh...they are back. When the heck did that happen?! And why am I suddenly, like, really good at teleporting? I bet I could go anywhere I want! In fact, that gives me an idea...Hey, D, I think it's time we met face-to-face!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The journey continues
reviews.reviewText: This Volume has us following the ogre that’s been on a rampage since the last Volume, as well as our usual Demon Lord party. They’ve finally made it to the demon territory, much to the surprise of Sophia and White. Why surprise? Well, it seems the demon territory isn’t that different from the human ones.White and Sophia were expecting things to look like they do in the media back on Earth, but if anything, it’s just as lovely, if not more so than where they’ve stayed in the human countries. Of course that would come as a surprise. Not only that, but it seems that not everyone in the demon territory is onboard with the Demon Lord’s plan to go to war with the humans. That leads to some drama and behind the scenes maneuverings that you wouldn’t expect. I was under the impression that the return of the Demon Lord would be met with fanfare and acceptance, not the veiled hostility and apprehension we get.On top of that, the orge who’s been wreaking havoc doesn’t seem to be slowing down at all. If anything, he’s been growing stronger the more he’s been raging. That leads to another confrontation between him, White and Sophia. And man is it an explosive one!We see White start to learn more about her powers and how to control them now that she’s a god. that’s fun, as is seeing how much stronger Sophia’s becoming. Granted, we do have the benefit of knowing how OP they are in the future but the journey there is entertaining. I always enjoy seeing how strong people get their overwhelming strength. It’s why White’s journey has been such a blast to be on!we learn more about the orge, and why he is the way he is. We get to see it from his perspective, which makes his backstory that much harder to swallow. Seriously, the guy can’t catch a break!We also get to meet D, the “evil god” that’s basically behind everything that’s going on. And I do mean actually meet. We’ve “heard” her voice through the smartphone that appears every now and then, but White actually makes the journey to meet D in person, and man oh man are the revelations from that meeting crazy. I won’t say any more than that so as not to spoil anything, but things sure have gotten complicated.All in all, this was a great Volume, that sets up things moving forward, and even though we know where they ultimately lead, there’s no disputing the fact that the journey to the destination will be a crazy one to say the least.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great, series overall has some editing-related consistency issues
reviews.reviewText: The story is great, I recommend!Minor issues I have are mostly editing-related consistency issues. Example: The use of poisonous and venomous as if they mean the same thing. Example 2: The puppet taratect stats are constantly mentioned but flip-flop between 1,000 average stats and 10,000 average stats. That's a big difference. Example 3: We have a character named Bloe. Okay. Next volume, he's Blow. Maybe an editing correction? Next volume, he's Bloe, again. Please make up your mind.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Threading Back Together
reviews.reviewText: Even after nine volumes, this series only continue to improve. So much so that I must ask why you're reading this review instead of the book? But it. Read it. Read it again. Then burn your eyes out re-reading them all, it's worth it, as you quickly find out.I can't say much due to spoilers, but my only complaint in this entire volume has to do with the ending. It's a bit too rushed, not just with the reveal, but White's reaction to finally meeting D. Some of that emotional mess could have been carried into the future, where it would benefit greatly with some flushing out and a proper confrontation between the newly "reborn" White and Ariel, as those two really do need to talk things out, preferably over a glass (or cask) of wine. We've had far too few moments of characters actually having serious conversations about their experiences since we've delved into White's past at volume 6, but in all fairness, they've been quite busy trying to stave off the end of the world a few times. Plus, the moments where the characters get to act cute more than make up for it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2022
reviews.reviewText: That was hinted at by a couple of things. I have to wonder how much of the world building was planned from the beginning and how much is made up on the fly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely a must read
reviews.reviewText: Simply amazing.. i just picked up this series two weeks ago and now i’m all caught to it as much as i’m sad that i have to wait for the next book to come out.The characters are amazing, the action is top notch, the revelation on some of the stuff is mind plowing.There were part were it felt that the writer was giving us so much filler like writing the same things over and over again but with a different way or a different perspective from other characters which felt dragging at time, bit that doesn’t hold you much down for wanting more and more.I fell in love with this series, i can’t wait for the anime to come out, maybe i will be able to buy a kumoko plush then .. because i need kumoko in my life ..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I have a hard time writing reviews right after reading.
reviews.reviewText: I suppose I would like to say first: I bought this volume half way through the day and finished it before the day was done, so obviously it was enjoyable. I do have some "buts" though. First, I'm not really sure what to think about the introduction of this new character, I think if you make an opinion if the situation based on this one volume alone... That is insufficient. As for the D and white thing, I'm not sure either.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I NEED MORE SPIDER
reviews.reviewText: I normally don't write reviews,but, I guess making one for something that I adore is indeed fun. Let's start! I adore... ADORE this volume, I know some people complained about the story not moving forward much in the past volume. This volume makes up A LOT for the last one, like we get a lot of developments here and set ups for what's to come. And some interesting changes from the web novel. I literally read the volume in like a day (I'm a slow reader), I just couldn't stop!!! It makes sense that things are a bit slower after the whole crazy stuff from volume 7. We get HUGE reveals about the world and characters that will NOT disappoint any of you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 5, 2022

reviews.reviewText: War ein Geschenk, kann nicht viel dazu sagen!

Pensarias que seria un volumen de relleno con pocas escenas de accion y baam esa fue la mejor parte del volumen, el mundo se empieza a ampliar, mas alla de los limites del planeta, realmente la saco del parque, estuvo genial y las escenas de comedia fueron hilarantes. Esperando el siguiente volumen para mas kumo y esperando el anime con ansias en enero leyendo la siguiente novela
